content: On November 4, 1995, the Atlanta Braves celebrated their first World Series championship since relocating to Atlanta, having clinched the title just days earlier on October 28. The Braves defeated the Cleveland Indians in a dramatic six-game series, with Tom Glavine earning the decisive victory in Game 6. This victory marked a significant milestone for the franchise, as it was their first championship since the Boston Braves won in 1914, and it solidified the Braves' dominance in the 1990s, culminating in a season that showcased their pitching prowess and strong lineup.
